body_html:
I can't do a proper review of the yml, because it's already checked in, but we're due for one.

pytorch/.circleci/config.yml

Line 12 in 63b8ac1

no_output_timeout: "10h"

This seems like an outlandishly large timeout for a git merge

pytorch/.circleci/config.yml

Line 22 in 63b8ac1

export GIT_MERGE_TARGET=`git log -n 1 --pretty=format:"%H" origin/master`

Use git rev-parse origin/master instead. Much shorter, and it's appropriate use of Git plumbing. https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Internals-Plumbing-and-Porcelain

pytorch/.circleci/config.yml

Line 27 in 63b8ac1

git checkout -f ${GIT_COMMIT}

Shouldn't you already be checked out at this point?

pytorch/.circleci/config.yml

Line 28 in 63b8ac1

git reset --hard ${GIT_COMMIT}

And if you just checked out that commit, why do you need to do a hard reset?

pytorch/.circleci/config.yml

Line 34 in 63b8ac1

working_directory: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace

LOL. I guess it will be forever immortalized in our Docker images haha.

pytorch/.circleci/config.yml

Line 41 in 63b8ac1

no_output_timeout: "10h"

no_output_timeout here is appropriate, but it still seems ludicrously high. There are a bunch more of these which I will no longer comment on.

pytorch/.circleci/config.yml

Line 116 in 63b8ac1

docker push ${COMMIT_DOCKER_IMAGE}

I'd quite like to get rid of this ASAP.

pytorch/.circleci/config.yml

Line 119 in 63b8ac1

- persist_to_workspace:

You're pushing Docker now. Do you need this?

pytorch/.circleci/config.yml

Line 132 in 63b8ac1

sudo chmod -R 777 /home/circleci/project/pytorch-ci-env

Hmm?

pytorch/.circleci/config.yml

Line 142 in 63b8ac1

sudo apt-get update

The copypasta BUUURNS

pytorch/.circleci/config.yml

Line 338 in 63b8ac1

sudo ln /dev/null /dev/raw1394

WTF! (No action needed)

pytorch/.circleci/config.yml

Line 472 in 63b8ac1

- image: 308535385114.dkr.ecr.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/pytorch/pytorch-linux-trusty-py2.7.9:248

Doesn't this mean DockerVersion updates are broken now?

I can't do a proper review of the yml, because it's already checked in, but we're due for one.

Doesn't this mean DockerVersion updates are broken now?
body:
I can't do a proper review of the yml, because it's already checked in, but we're due for one.

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/63b8ac1ff168089026201e11a113bb8b5d0b91cf/.circleci/config.yml#L12

This seems like an outlandishly large timeout for a git merge

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/63b8ac1ff168089026201e11a113bb8b5d0b91cf/.circleci/config.yml#L22

Use `git rev-parse origin/master` instead. Much shorter, and it's appropriate use of Git plumbing. https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Internals-Plumbing-and-Porcelain

> https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/63b8ac1ff168089026201e11a113bb8b5d0b91cf/.circleci/config.yml#L27

Shouldn't you already be checked out at this point?

> https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/63b8ac1ff168089026201e11a113bb8b5d0b91cf/.circleci/config.yml#L28

And if you just checked out that commit, why do you need to do a hard reset?

> https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/63b8ac1ff168089026201e11a113bb8b5d0b91cf/.circleci/config.yml#L34

LOL. I guess it will be forever immortalized in our Docker images haha.

> https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/63b8ac1ff168089026201e11a113bb8b5d0b91cf/.circleci/config.yml#L41

`no_output_timeout` here is appropriate, but it still seems ludicrously high. There are a bunch more of these which I will no longer comment on.

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/63b8ac1ff168089026201e11a113bb8b5d0b91cf/.circleci/config.yml#L116

I'd quite like to get rid of this ASAP.

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/63b8ac1ff168089026201e11a113bb8b5d0b91cf/.circleci/config.yml#L119

You're pushing Docker now. Do you need this?

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/63b8ac1ff168089026201e11a113bb8b5d0b91cf/.circleci/config.yml#L132

Hmm?

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/63b8ac1ff168089026201e11a113bb8b5d0b91cf/.circleci/config.yml#L142

The copypasta BUUURNS

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/63b8ac1ff168089026201e11a113bb8b5d0b91cf/.circleci/config.yml#L338

WTF! (No action needed)

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/63b8ac1ff168089026201e11a113bb8b5d0b91cf/.circleci/config.yml#L472

Doesn't this mean DockerVersion updates are broken now?
